reviews.review: Portal 2 is way better but this is still fire
Still holds up to this day
amazing. even after many years this masterpiece stands as a footnote in gaming history
Fun game! Something different. Nice work
if you give this a badge, then i give you cake
Such amazing athmosphere. Portal 2 is good, but can't beat this game's strange feeling. (Maybe only the old aperture can)
Not as good as Portal 2 but a puzzle good game with challenging puzzles everyone should try nonetheless.

Portal halt, muss man einfach gespielt haben einer der besten Puzzle Plattformer
ebenfall empfehlenswert Portal 2, Quantum Conundrum, Talos Principle ( extrem schwer)
wirklich schade das Valve keine Spiele mehr macht und sich einfach nur auf steam ausruht
Absolute classic, one of the best games ever made

Honestly one of my favorite games of all time that I come back to every once in a while. It's short but fun and always delivers, plus there's a plethora of content to be downloaded that adds additional levels. Bought it on sale in 2017 for $1 and have been extremely happy with it.
I like this game. At first I didn't fully understand the rules, but once I got it, the game came to be very good.

PARENTS READ THIS
This is a great game its fun and challenging. but there is a few things...
Turrents can shoot you and results to blood. you can turn it off by the dev console so it wont happen again
But every thing else is ok

Its funny, its challenging, it got great character(s) and has such a fun mechanic. Its not the longest game but that doesnt mean you cant spend quite a few hours with it. Im really sensible to dread and like... creepy stuff so at some points I was truly uncomfortable BUT that was the intention after all. It wasnt too bad, that I didnt want to play anymore, so I think its safe to assume the majority of people wont have a problem with it either.
Conclusion: A classic thats definitely worth its money! :)

[h1] Portal - 8/10 [/h1]
[b] Playthrough Length - [/b] 2.2 hours

[b] Plot and Dialogue: [/b] 8/10, 9/10
[b] Setting and Art Design: [/b] 6/10
[b] Soundtrack: [/b] 5/10
[b] Graphics: [/b] 5/10
[b] Gameplay and Sound Design: [/b] 10/10, 8/10

[b] Plot and Dialogue: [/b]
The plot of this game is told with environmental storytelling, and it's done absolutely excellently. You can somewhat piece together the situation what has happened and you get final confirmation at the end of the game. The dialogue is also pretty good, playing on tones of suspicion and general creepiness.

[b] Setting and Art Design: [/b]
The setting and art design of the laboratory and then the insides of it are done well, but it didn't completely resonate with me as a lot of the assets were reused from Half-Life 2. 

[b] Soundtrack: [/b]
There was only one song that I can recall that was played and it was for a brief moment near the end of the game. Pretty mediocre over all. 

[b] Graphics: [/b]
Graphics have held up alright to this day but they aren't anything great and they certainly aren't the reason why you'd want to play this game. 

[b] Gameplay and Sound Design: [/b]
The gameplay is why you play this game. It is really innovative in terms of puzzle solving, not holding your hands. The earlier levels are pretty easy but the game does ramp up in difficulty and eventually, it isn't too easy, but it isn't too hard either. I find it at the right level of difficulty and it came off as extremely rewarding. The sound design is also very well done, so props to Valve. 

[b] Final Notes: [/b]
This game holds up very well to this day, especially so with the gameplay. I highly recommend this game for its base price and especially so when it's on sale.

This game lives up to its hype. The levels are fun and the story is funny yet disturbing. My one piece of advice is to go into the advanced video settings before you start the game and enable motion blur and vertical syncing, otherwise the game will look pretty gross when you turn your character. Other than that, amazing game and I would definitely recommend!
